history.content:
You do not need to submit your double major application by your 5th semester (as long as you've declared one of your majors), and I do not think that either department would have such a policy (or be allowed to...?).

I believe that the requirement is that you have to declare your majors before your last semester.

Reading your post, it sounds like you already know the answer. Since both these courses are taught at an accelerated pace, and your grade matters for both, you're not making things easy for yourself. Keep in mind that resources like HKN tutoring and CSM are often unavailable over summer.

Have you taken Math 54 or EE 16A to prepare for CS 70? Are you a freshman? Sophomore? Adding a last name to your account would make it easier to advise.

Reading your post, it sounds like you already know the answer. Since both these courses are taught at an accelerated pace, and your grade matters for both, you're not making things easy for yourself. Keep in mind that resources like HKN tutoring and CSM are often unavailable over summer. Have you taken Math 54 or EE 16A to prepare for CS 70? Are you a freshman? Sophomore?

children.subject:
Re: Instructor's response

I haven't taken Math 54 or EE 16A (I was planning on taking those this fall), but I just finished talking with an advisor, and she suggested I consider taking 16A over the summer to prepare for 70 and then take 70 in the fall. 

I also realized I misunderstood the double major declaration process -- I thought I had to submit an application to declare both majors at the same time, but she said it's just encouraged to declare something by fourth/fifth semester, and then I can potentially declare the second major later on, which basically solves my whole predicament! :))))

So I'm probably dropping CogSci 1 and taking 16A or 70 over the summer! (and adding my last name to my account, sorry!)  :)

history.content:
If I really need an A- or A in CS 70 over summer (s/o to that 61B final #wrecked), how bad an idea would it be to take it with Cog Sci 1 at the same time? CS 70 starts 2 weeks before, and the last 6 weeks completely overlaps with cog sci. I'm planning on starting to learn 70 on my own + reading the cog sci textbook before the course starts.

I know Cog Sci is offered in fall but it doesn't seem like I'll get into the class, so taking both over summer seems like my only option for declaring (see below).

Also-- does anyone know if a CogSci/CS double major has to submit the double major app by their 5th semester? My impression was that this was the policy, but I know cog sci doesn't have a declaration deadline that early. I've gotten a lot of conflicting answers. (If this is the case, taking both over summer seems like my only option.)
history.subject: CS 70 + Cog Sci 1 over summer
